contextId.information: The words "high" and "elevated" emphasize that the throne was very high and above everything around it. The height of the throne represents how great and powerful the Lord is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The words "briers" and "thorns" both refer to useless, thorny plants. It is not necessary to translate both words. AT: "thorn bushes" or "brier bushes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases mean basically the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: As wandering birds, as a scattered nest

contextId.information: The words "mourning" and "lamenting" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of mourning. AT: "they will mourn deeply" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The phrase "a vision of the night" is the same thing as "a dream." The two phrases emphasize that soon it will be like the invading army was never there. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: It will be like a dream, a vision of the night

contextId.information: These mean the same thing and emphasize how quickly the wall will fall. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two words mean basically the same thing and emphasize the greatness of their shame. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Here "Jacob" and "men of Israel" mean the same thing. AT: "you people of Israel who are like worms" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Jacob you worm, and you men of Israel

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and indicate that Yahweh has kept himself from acting. AT: "I have kept myself from doing anything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: I have been still and restrained myself

contextId.information: The words "precious" and "special" mean basically the same thing and emphasize how much Yahweh values his people. AT: "Because you are very precious to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Since you are precious and special in my sight

contextId.information: The word "I" is repeated for emphasis. AT: "I alone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Yahweh uses two similar expressions in order to strengthen his encouragement. AT: "Do not be afraid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Do not fear or be afraid

contextId.information: These both refer to the descendants of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The words "ashamed" and "disgraced" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of shame. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Their idols will leave them all completely ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They will all be ashamed and disgraced together

contextId.information: These two words share similar meanings. They describe one who is beautiful and lives in luxury. AT: "very beautiful" or "very luxurious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Both of these refer to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "I" is repeated for emphasis. AT: "I myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "a waste" and "desolate" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that the enemy has destroyed Zion and left it empty. AT: "Though you were completely desolate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: Though you were a waste and desolate

contextId.information: These two phrases mean the same thing. AT: "inside the walls of my temple" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: in my house and within my walls
